questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: For a cylinder with volume V = πr²h, what is the new volume if the radius r is tripled?

content_zh.stem: For a cylinder with volume V = πr²h, what is the new volume if the radius r is tripled?

questions.explanation_en: V = πr²h. Tripling r: V_new = π(3r)²h = π(9r²)h = 9πr²h = 9 × V_old.
questions.explanation_zh: V = πr²h. Tripling r: V_new = π(3r)²h = π(9r²)h = 9πr²h = 9 × V_old.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G12-MATH-002 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: Jake's apple tree produces 50 apples monthly. Family eats 33; remaining sold at $2 each. Family eats 18 bananas monthly at $3 each. How many extra dollars beyond apple profits are needed for bananas?

content_zh.stem: Jake's apple tree produces 50 apples monthly. Family eats 33; remaining sold at $2 each. Family eats 18 bananas monthly at $3 each. How many extra dollars beyond apple profits are needed for bananas?

questions.explanation_en: Apple profit: (50 − 33) × $2 = 17 × $2 = $34. Banana cost: 18 × $3 = $54. Extra needed: $54 − $34 = $20.
questions.explanation_zh: Apple profit: (50 − 33) × $2 = 17 × $2 = $34. Banana cost: 18 × $3 = $54. Extra needed: $54 − $34 = $20.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G12-MATH-003 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math
questions.explanation_en: Apply power rule: d/dx(5x³) = 15x², d/dx(−2x) = −2, d/dx(7) = 0. So f'(x) = 15x² − 2.
questions.explanation_zh: Apply power rule: d/dx(5x³) = 15x², d/dx(−2x) = −2, d/dx(7) = 0. So f'(x) = 15x² − 2.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G12-MATH-101 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: A farmer has 120 meters of fencing to enclose a rectangular field. What dimensions maximize the area?

content_zh.stem: A farmer has 120 meters of fencing to enclose a rectangular field. What dimensions maximize the area?

questions.explanation_en: Perimeter = 2l + 2w = 120, so l + w = 60. Area A = l(60 − l). A'(l) = 60 − 2l = 0 → l = 30. So w = 30. Maximum area is a 30 × 30 square.
questions.explanation_zh: Perimeter = 2l + 2w = 120, so l + w = 60. Area A = l(60 − l). A'(l) = 60 − 2l = 0 → l = 30. So w = 30. Maximum area is a 30 × 30 square.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G12-MATH-102 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: A random sample of 100 lightbulbs has a mean lifetime of 1,200 hours with a standard deviation of 80 hours. What is the 95% confidence interval for the population mean? (z* = 1.96)

content_zh.stem: A random sample of 100 lightbulbs has a mean lifetime of 1,200 hours with a standard deviation of 80 hours. What is the 95% confidence interval for the population mean? (z* = 1.96)

questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G12-MATH-103 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: Scores on a standardized test are normally distributed with mean 500 and standard deviation 100. What percentage of students score between 400 and 600?

content_zh.stem: Scores on a standardized test are normally distributed with mean 500 and standard deviation 100. What percentage of students score between 400 and 600?

questions.explanation_en: 400 and 600 are each 1 standard deviation from the mean (z = ±1). By the empirical rule, about 68% of data falls within 1 standard deviation.
questions.explanation_zh: 400 and 600 are each 1 standard deviation from the mean (z = ±1). By the empirical rule, about 68% of data falls within 1 standard deviation.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G12-MATH-104 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: The position of a particle is given by s(t) = t³ − 6t² + 9t + 2. At what time(s) is the particle at rest?

content_zh.stem: The position of a particle is given by s(t) = t³ − 6t² + 9t + 2. At what time(s) is the particle at rest?

questions.explanation_en: Velocity v(t) = s'(t) = 3t² − 12t + 9 = 3(t² − 4t + 3) = 3(t − 1)(t − 3). Set v = 0: t = 1 and t = 3.
questions.explanation_zh: Velocity v(t) = s'(t) = 3t² − 12t + 9 = 3(t² − 4t + 3) = 3(t − 1)(t − 3). Set v = 0: t = 1 and t = 3.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G12-MATH-107 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: A researcher collects temperature data for 10 years and calculates r² = 0.87 for a linear model. Which interpretation is correct?
options: A. 87% of the variation in temperature is explained by the linear relationship with year
C. 87% of the data points lie on the regression line
D. The model predicts temperature with 87% accuracy

content_zh.stem: A researcher collects temperature data for 10 years and calculates r² = 0.87 for a linear model. Which interpretation is correct?
options: A. 87% of the variation in temperature is explained by the linear relationship with year
C. 87% of the data points lie on the regression line
D. The model predicts temperature with 87% accuracy

questions.explanation_en: r² (coefficient of determination) represents the proportion of variance in the dependent variable explained by the independent variable.
questions.explanation_zh: r² (coefficient of determination) represents the proportion of variance in the dependent variable explained by the independent variable.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G12-MATH-108 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: How many ways can the letters of the word 'LEVEL' be arranged?

content_zh.stem: How many ways can the letters of the word 'LEVEL' be arranged?

questions.explanation_en: LEVEL has 5 letters with L repeated 2 times and E repeated 2 times. Arrangements = 5!/(2! × 2!) = 120/4 = 30.
questions.explanation_zh: LEVEL has 5 letters with L repeated 2 times and E repeated 2 times. Arrangements = 5!/(2! × 2!) = 120/4 = 30.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G12-MATH-109 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: After a 2025 earthquake, a relief agency models supply delivery cost as C(x) = 500/x + 2x, where x is the number of trucks dispatched. How many trucks minimize cost?

content_zh.stem: After a 2025 earthquake, a relief agency models supply delivery cost as C(x) = 500/x + 2x, where x is the number of trucks dispatched. How many trucks minimize cost?

questions.explanation_en: C'(x) = −500/x² + 2 = 0 → 500/x² = 2 → x² = 250 → x = sqrt(250) ≈ 15.81. Since x must be a whole number, x = 16 trucks.
questions.explanation_zh: C'(x) = −500/x² + 2 = 0 → 500/x² = 2 → x² = 250 → x = sqrt(250) ≈ 15.81. Since x must be a whole number, x = 16 trucks.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G12-MATH-110 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)
